title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer with justification

x = 6 is the only critical point at which f' changes sign from negative to positive. Therefore, f has a local minimum at x = 6.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

x = 6 is the only critical point at which f' changes sign from negative to positive. Therefore, f has a local minimum at x = 6.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

x = 6 is the only critical point at which f' changes sign from negative to positive. Therefore, f has a local minimum at x = 6.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for considering x = 0 and x = 6

1 point is earned for the answer

1 point is earned for justification

From part (a), the absolute minimum occurs either at x = 6 or at an endpoint.

f( 0 )=f( 8 )+ ∫ 8 0 f ′ ( x )dx         =f( 8 )− ∫ 0 8 f ′ ( x )dx =4−12=−8 f( 6 )=f( 8 )+ ∫ 8 6 f ′ ( x )dx         =f( 8 )− ∫ 6 8 f ′ ( x )dx =4−7=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8EFC@

f(8) = 4

The absolute minimum value of f on the closed interval [0, 8] is -8.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

1 point is earned for the explanation

The graph of f is concave down and increasing on 0 < x < 1 and 3 < x < 4, because f' is decreasing and positive on these intervals.
descriptions:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for g'(x)
